results.title: Fine feathers
results.brief_description: In this cut-out colour cartoon by film artist Evelyn Lambart, two quarrelsome birds get the urge to change their plumage. A bluejay wants to be decked out in the green of the cedar, and a loon in the burnished red of oak leaves. There is a moral to the story. Neither bird had reckoned on the consequences of vanity. Along comes a gust of wind and both learn to their consternation that their natural, well-anchored feathers offered better protection.

results.title: Finding the way home
results.creator_credit: Children's Welfare Association of Victoria and Julie McDonald
results.brief_description: Foster parents in rural Victoria discuss what it’s like to care for a foster child, covering issues such as selecting a child, financial implications, emotional support, and most importantly, the benefits. Families interviewed include a single mother with children, an older childless couple, and a middle aged couple with their own children. A young man whose lived with a foster family also shares his experience. Worthwhile viewing for anyone considering fostering a child. Supported by the Federal Department of Family and Community Services.

results.title: Finding Nemo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios, Graham Walters and Andrew Stanton
results.brief_description: A beautifully colourful and enchanting computer animated feature about a father clown fish, Marlin, searching the vast ocean near Sydney for his lost son, Nemo. Marlin pairs up with Dory (voice provided by comic Ellen DeGeneres) who suffers short-term memory loss and Nemo finds himself in a fish tank in a dentist’s office. The experiences the father and son have provide the viewer with an action-packed, sometimes fearsome and fun-filled adventure. (Please Note: some scenes may frighten young children)

results.title: Finding Nemo
results.creator_credit: Pixar Animation Studios, Walt Disney Pictures, Graham Walters and Andrew Stanton
results.brief_description: When Nemo, a young clownfish, is unexpectedly carried far from home, his father Marlin, and Dory, a friendly but forgetful regal blue tang fish embark on an epic journey. Features the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem DaFoe, Brad Garrett.

results.title: Finding information
results.brief_description: In learning to raise a baby bird a boy gets information in a number of ways: by advice from “an authority”, by observation, by consulting reference materials in the library, by doing an informal experiment and by exploring community resources. Imparts an awareness of the process of learning and problem solving.
